text.div:
Generated Narrative: ImplementationGuide template.cpg-on-ebmonfhir.netzwerk-universitaetsmedizin.de

CPGonEBMonFHIRtemplate

The official URL for this implementation guide is: 

https://www.netzwerk-universitaetsmedizin.de/fhir/cpg-on-ebmonfhir/example/ImplementationGuide/template.cpg-on-ebmonfhir.netzwerk-universitaetsmedizin.de

extension.valueMarkdown: Automatically added as a dependency - all IGs depend on HL7 Terminology
Automatically added as a dependency - all IGs depend on the HL7 Extension Pack

resource.name: CODEX-CELIDA
resource.description: Concepts required in recommendations that are not defined elsewhere

resource.name: Daily Assessment of the Duration of Antibiotic Therapy
resource.description: All Antibiotics are daily re-evaluated for the Duration of Therapy for each Antibiotic.

resource.name: Daily Assessment of the Focus for Antibiotics
resource.description: All Antibiotics are daily re-evaluated for the Focus for each Antibiotic.

resource.name: Daily Assessment of the Indication for Antibiotics
resource.description: All Antibiotics are daily re-evaluated for the Indication for each Antibiotic.

resource.name: Daily Assessments of Readiness-to-wean from mechanical ventilation
resource.description: Readiness-to-wean from mechanical ventilation is assessed periodically every day.

resource.name: Daily Documentation of Treatment Goals
resource.description: Treatment Goals should be documented daily for every Intensive Care Patient.

resource.name: Daily Evaluation of Readiness-to-Wean and/or Weaning Trials
resource.description: All invasive ventilated Intensive Care Patients should be evaluated for their readiness-to-wean and/or receive weaning trials at least once every day.

resource.name: Daily Mobilization
resource.description: Mobilization that occurs at least once a day.

resource.name: Daily multiprofessional ward rounds
resource.description: Every Intensive Care Patient should be visited daily in multiprofessional ward rounds led by an intensive care specialist.

resource.name: Daily multiprofessional ward rounds
resource.description: Every Intensive Care Patient is visited daily in multiprofessional ward rounds led by an intensive care specialist.

resource.name: Daily Stop-Orders for Invasive Devices
resource.description: All invasive devices have a daily re-evaluation regarding the necessity of each device.

resource.name: Daily Treatment Goals
resource.description: Daily Treatment Goals are set at least once every day.

resource.name: Daily Weaning Trials
resource.description: Weaning trials are performed periodically every day.

resource.name: Delirium Assessment during Early Shift
resource.description: Delirium should be assessed once between 6 AM and <2 PM every day.

resource.name: Delirium Assessment during Late Shift
resource.description: Delirium should be assessed once between 2 AM and <10 PM every day.

resource.name: Delirium Assessment during Night Shift
resource.description: Delirium should be assessed once between 10 PM and <6 AM every day.

resource.name: Discharge with dependence on home ventilation
resource.description: The fraction of patients discharged with dependence on home ventilation should be low.

resource.name: DIVI Quality Indicator 1
resource.description: DIVI Quality Indicator 1: Daily multiprofessional ward rounds with documentation of treatment goals

resource.name: DIVI Quality Indicator 2
resource.description: DIVI Quality Indicator 2: Management of Sedation, Analgesia and Delirium

resource.name: DIVI Quality Indicator 3
resource.description: DIVI Quality Indicator 3: Patient-adapted Ventilation

resource.name: DIVI Quality Indicator 4
resource.description: DIVI Quality Indicator 4: Early Weaning from Invasive Ventilation

resource.name: DIVI Quality Indicator 5
resource.description: DIVI Quality Indicator 5: Infection Prevention

resource.name: DIVI Quality Indicator 6
resource.description: DIVI Quality Indicator 6: Infection Management

resource.name: DIVI Quality Indicator 7
resource.description: DIVI Quality Indicator 7: Patient-adapted Clinical Nutrition

resource.name: DIVI Quality Indicator 8
resource.description: DIVI Quality Indicator 8: Structured Communication with Patients and Relatives

resource.name: DIVI Quality Indicator 9
resource.description: DIVI Quality Indicator 9: Early Mobilization

resource.name: DIVI Sektion Qualit채tsverbesserung und Informationstechnologie Qualit채tsindikatoren Semantik
resource.description: DIVI Sektion Qualit채tsverbesserung und Informationstechnologie Qualit채tsindikatoren Semantik

resource.name: Driving Pressure Limitation
resource.description: Driving Pressure should be limited to a maximum of 15 cmH2O in all invasive ventilated ICU patients with severe ARDS.

resource.name: Early Enteral Feeding
resource.description: All Intensive Care Patients for which a sufficient oral nutrition is not expected on day one should be started on enteral feeding within 24 hours.

resource.name: First Communication with Patients and/or their Relatives within 72 hours
resource.description: An initial structured communication with the Patients and/or their Relatives occurs within 72 hours of Admission to Intensive Care.

resource.name: First Enteral Feeding Within 24 hours
resource.description: First Enteral Feeding occurs within 24 hours after Admission to Intensive Care.

resource.name: First Mobilization within 24 hours
resource.description: First Mobilization occurs within 24 hours after Admission to Intensive Care.

resource.name: Frequency of Blood Cultures
resource.description: The Frequency of Blood Cultures should be at least 80 per 1000 days.

resource.name: Frequent Blood Cultures
resource.description: The Frequency of Blood Cultures is at least 80 per 1000 days.

resource.name: Hand Disinfectant Consumption
resource.description: The consumption of hand disinfectant should be more than 80 litres per 1000 days.

resource.name: Indication, Focus and Duration of Therapy for Antibiotics
resource.description: All Intensive Care Patients with Antibiotics should have a daily re-evaluation of the Indication, Focus and Duration of Therapy for each Antibiotic.

resource.name: Infection-per-Device Ratio
resource.description: The number of infections per invasive devices is at zero.

resource.name: Inital Mobilization
resource.description: All Intensive Care Patients should be mobilized within 24 hours after admission to ICU.

resource.name: Inital Structured Communication with Patients and/or Relatives
resource.description: For all Intensive Care Patients, an initial structured communication with the Patients and/or their Relatives should take place within 72 hours of Admission to Intensive Care.

resource.name: No Discharge with Home Ventilation
resource.description: The patient is not discharged with home ventilation.

resource.name: Pain Assessment during Early Shift
resource.description: Pain should be assessed once between 6 AM and <2 PM every day.

resource.name: Pain Assessment during Late Shift
resource.description: Pain should be assessed once between 2 AM and <10 PM every day.

resource.name: Pain Assessment during Night Shift
resource.description: Pain should be assessed once between 10 PM and <6 AM every day.

resource.name: PEEP adjusted to FiO2=0.21-0.29
resource.description: PEEP should be adjusted according to the table on ardsnet.org in dependence of the FiO2 required to achieve adequate oxygenation in all ventilated ICU patients with severe ARDS.

resource.name: PEEP adjusted to FiO2=0.30-0.39
resource.description: PEEP should be adjusted according to the table on ardsnet.org in dependence of the FiO2 required to achieve adequate oxygenation in all ventilated ICU patients with severe ARDS.

resource.name: PEEP adjusted to FiO2=0.40-0.49
resource.description: PEEP should be adjusted according to the table on ardsnet.org in dependence of the FiO2 required to achieve adequate oxygenation in all ventilated ICU patients with severe ARDS.

resource.name: PEEP adjusted to FiO2=0.50-0.59
resource.description: PEEP should be adjusted according to the table on ardsnet.org in dependence of the FiO2 required to achieve adequate oxygenation in all ventilated ICU patients with severe ARDS.

resource.name: PEEP adjusted to FiO2=0.60-0.79
resource.description: PEEP should be adjusted according to the table on ardsnet.org in dependence of the FiO2 required to achieve adequate oxygenation in all ventilated ICU patients with severe ARDS.

resource.name: PEEP adjusted to FiO2=0.80-0.99
resource.description: PEEP should be adjusted according to the table on ardsnet.org in dependence of the FiO2 required to achieve adequate oxygenation in all ventilated ICU patients with severe ARDS.

resource.name: PEEP adjusted to FiO2=1.00
resource.description: PEEP should be adjusted according to the table on ardsnet.org in dependence of the FiO2 required to achieve adequate oxygenation in all ventilated ICU patients with severe ARDS.

resource.name: Periodic Assessment of Sedation Level, Analgesia Level and Delirium Status
resource.description: Sedation Level, Analgesia Level and Delirium Status should be assessed at least once in each shift (time-slots 6-14, 14-22, 22-6) in all Intensive Care Patients.

resource.name: Periodic Mobilization
resource.description: All Intensive Care Patients that don't have a no-mobilization order should be mobilized at least once every day.

resource.name: Periodic Structured Communication with Patients and/or Relatives
resource.description: For all Intensive Care Patients, at least one structured communication with the Patients and/or their Relatives should take place every week.

resource.name: Plateau Pressure Limitation
resource.description: Plateau Pressure should be limited to a maximum of 30 cmH2O in all invasive ventilated ICU patients with severe ARDS.

resource.name: Pneumonia-per-Ventilated-Patients Ratio
resource.description: The number of pneumonia cases per ventilated patients should be low.

resource.name: Population: Intensive Care Patients
resource.description: Intensive Care Patients

resource.name: Population: Intensive Care Patients that are clinically fed and have no Adipositas
resource.description: Intensive Care Patients that are clinically fed and have no Adipositas

resource.name: Population: Intensive Care Patients with at least one antibiotic
resource.description: Intensive Care Patients with at least one antibiotic

resource.name: Population: Intensive Care Patients with at least one invasive device
resource.description: Intensive Care Patients with at least one invasive device

resource.name: Population: Intensive Care Patients with Intensive Care Treatment Longer Than Three Days
resource.description: Intensive Care Patients with Intensive Care Treatment Longer Than Three Days

resource.name: Population: Intensive Care Patients with Invasive Ventilation
resource.description: Intensive Care Patients with Invasive Ventilation

resource.name: Population: Intensive Care Patients with Invasive Ventilation and no Home Ventilation
resource.description: Intensive Care Patients with Invasive Ventilation and no Home Ventilation

resource.name: Population: Intensive Care Patients with Predicted Insufficient Energy Intake
resource.description: Intensive Care Patients with Predicted Insufficient Energy Intake

resource.name: Population: Intensive Care Patients with Severe ARDS and Invasive Ventilation
resource.description: Intensive Care Patients with Severe ARDS and Invasive Ventilation

resource.name: Population: Intensive Care Patients with Severe ARDS and Invasive Ventilation with FiO2=0.21-0.29
resource.description: Intensive Care Patients with Severe ARDS and Invasive Ventilation with FiO2=0.21-0.29

resource.name: Population: Intensive Care Patients with Severe ARDS and Invasive Ventilation with FiO2=0.30-0.39
resource.description: Intensive Care Patients with Severe ARDS and Invasive Ventilation with FiO2=0.30-0.39

resource.name: Population: Intensive Care Patients with Severe ARDS and Invasive Ventilation with FiO2=0.40-0.49
resource.description: Intensive Care Patients with Severe ARDS and Invasive Ventilation with FiO2=0.40-0.49

resource.name: Population: Intensive Care Patients with Severe ARDS and Invasive Ventilation with FiO2=0.50-0.59
resource.description: Intensive Care Patients with Severe ARDS and Invasive Ventilation with FiO2=0.50-0.59

resource.name: Population: Intensive Care Patients with Severe ARDS and Invasive Ventilation with FiO2=0.60-0.79
resource.description: Intensive Care Patients with Severe ARDS and Invasive Ventilation with FiO2=0.60-0.79

resource.name: Population: Intensive Care Patients with Severe ARDS and Invasive Ventilation with FiO2=0.80-0.99
resource.description: Intensive Care Patients with Severe ARDS and Invasive Ventilation with FiO2=0.80-0.99

resource.name: Population: Intensive Care Patients with Severe ARDS and Invasive Ventilation with FiO2=1.00
resource.description: Intensive Care Patients with Severe ARDS and Invasive Ventilation with FiO2=1.00

resource.name: Population: Intensive Care Patients without a no-mobilization order
resource.description: Intensive Care Patients without a no-mobilization order

resource.name: Sedation Assessment during Early Shift
resource.description: Sedation should be assessed once between 6 AM and <2 PM every day.

resource.name: Sedation Assessment during Late Shift
resource.description: Sedation should be assessed once between 2 AM and <10 PM every day.

resource.name: Sedation Assessment during Night Shift
resource.description: Sedation should be assessed once between 10 PM and <6 AM every day.

resource.name: Sedation Level, Analgesia Level and Delirium Status in acceptable ranges.
resource.description: Sedation Level, Analgesia Level and Delirium Status should be in acceptable ranges.

resource.name: Stop Orders for Invasive Devices
resource.description: All Intensive Care Patients with invasive devices should have a daily re-evaluation regarding the necessity of each device.

resource.name: Sufficient Feeding in Non-Adipose Patients
resource.description: Every day, all Non-Adipose Intensive Care Patients should receive the amount of Calories that match their daily individual requirements.

resource.name: The daily calorie intake is sufficient
resource.description: The daily amount of calories matches the individual requirements.

resource.name: Tidal Volume Limitation
resource.description: Tidal volume should be limited to a maximum of 6 ml/kg ideal body weight in all invasive ventilated ICU patients with severe ARDS.

resource.name: Weekly Communication with Patients and Relatives
resource.description: At least one structured communication with the Patients and/or their Relatives takes place every week.
